item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Ross Ulbricht granted a full pardon (915 points | 921 comments)
2. Stargate Project: SoftBank, OpenAI, Oracle, MGX to build data centers (604 points | 651 comments)
3. 0-click deanonymization attack targeting Signal, Discord, other platforms (1175 points | 378 comments)
4. Moving on from React, a year later (177 points | 97 comments)
5. Infinigen (85 points | 8 comments)
6. Hunyuan3D 2.0 – High-Resolution 3D Assets Generation (190 points | 82 comments)
7. DHS removes all members of cyber security advisory boards, halts investigations (28 points | 6 comments)
8. Isolating complexity is the essence of successful abstractions (82 points | 20 comments)
9. Tensor Product Attention Is All You Need (54 points | 36 comments)
10. Icelandic turf houses: Laufas, Glaumbaer and others (11 points | 1 comment)
11. Invisible Electrostatic Wall at 3M plant (1996) (326 points | 162 comments)
12. Arm releases Chiplet System Architecture spec beta version (3 points | discuss)
13. Calm tech certification "rewards" less distracting tech (264 points | 69 comments)
14. What are these bumps on the top of a pull-tab can? (146 points | 12 comments)
15. Why is zero plural? (2024) (50 points | 80 comments)
16. Castle Game Engine: Web target – big progress, first 3 demos to try (70 points | 12 comments)
17. Flame: A small language model for spreadsheet formulas (2023) (17 points | 1 comment)
18. Mercator: Extreme (148 points | 30 comments)
19. The first release of OpenVox, the OSS implementation of Puppet (25 points | 7 comments)
20. Ask HN: Is anyone doing anything cool with tiny language models? (367 points | 169 comments)
21. Open-source browser port of Pitfall from the Atari 2600 (53 points | 12 comments)
22. Dissecting "Tiny Clouds" shadertoy (2017) (35 points | discuss)
23. The Peppermills of Jens Quistgaard (65 points | 39 comments)
24. JReleaser: quick and effortless way to release your project (75 points | 22 comments)
25. Life in Another Light, 2024 Infrared-Photography-Contest Winners (4 points | 1 comment)
26. Prime numbers so memorable that people hunt for them (130 points | 71 comments)
27. Sigstore: Making sure your software is what it claims to be (74 points | 20 comments)
28. HyperDX (YC S22) is hiring engineers to build open source observability ( | hide)
29. More than 40% of postdocs leave academia, study reveals (182 points | 204 comments)
30. Show HN: I made a app that uses NFC as a physical switch to block distractions (174 points | 96 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 at 8:20 AM UTC
